N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 346.4 - Purchase of service agreements

State Regulations
(a) The SCU shall contract with a local
commercial bank for such services the bank can perform as shall be necessary
for SCU operation. All checks on such account must bear the signature of the
commissioner of the local department of social services, or such designee of
the commissioner as the department may approve. The account title shall be
"(district name) Support Collection Unit."
(b) The SCU may enter into written purchase
of service agreements with private providers to assist with the functions
required under section
346.1
of this Part. Such
agreements shall provide for: (1)
adequate
supervision and monitoring by State and local social services
officials; (2)
confidential
treatment of all information received pursuant to such agreements, as specified
in section
346.1
(e) and (f)
of this Part; and
(3)
bonding of
employees who have access to or control over child support collections, as
required by section
346.5
of this Part. (c) All agreements shall be
submitted to the State Office of Child Support Enforcement for prior
approval. (d) Each local social
services district shall supply to the department such information as is
required to support claims for Federal and State reimbursement for services
performed under agreements entered into pursuant to subdivisions (a) and (b) of
this section, as well as services performed under agreements executed between
the State Department of Social Services and other agencies and
officials. Notes
